availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William L Manson (Hamilton County, Ohio, Deputy United States Marshal)

body.p: Hamilton County, Ohio, Deputy United States Marshal. Maryland native. Son of Sarah L. Manson. Married to Mary E. Reck Manson in Fairfield County, Ohio on January 23, 1855. Father to Fannie Manson, William S. Manson, Virginia Manson, and Edward R. Manson. Lived in Fairfield County in 1850. Deputy U.S. Marshal in Hamilton County in 1860. Employed Susan Wingel as a house servant in 1860. Deputy U.S. Marshal in Hamilton County in 1861.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Ohio, Fairfield County, Lancaster Corporation, p. 288A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Ohio, Hamilton County, Cincinnati Ward 8, p. 197.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Kenton County, Buena Vista Precinct, p. 277B.
Ohio Marriage Records, Fairfield County Courthouse, Lancaster, Ohio, Fairfield County Marriages, Film #000295269, p. 91.
Williams' Cincinnati Directory, City Guide and Business Mirror for 1861, (Cincinnati, OH: C. S. Williams, 1861), 241.
Find A Grave, "William Lewis Manson (1830-1896)," Memorial #141590731, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/141590731 (accessed May 13, 2021).
